title: Château l'Argenteyre 2015  Médoc
description: With a blast of Petit Verdot in the blend (15%, not typical Médoc), this structured, toasty wine revels in its ripe tannins. It is packed with fruit, with a dry core that will allow it to age. Drink the wine from 2024.

title: Amalie Robert 2013 The Uncarved Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a fine introduction to the winery's low alcohol, elegant stable of Pinots. Rhubarb and strawberry fruit comes with a lightly toasty note, and a dash of cocoa. Whole cluster fermentation and indigenous yeast ar the playbook at this winery.

title: Argyle 2013 Artisan Series Brut Rosé Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: Essentially two-thirds Pinot Noir (65%), the blend also includes 15% Pinot Meunier and 20% Chardonnay. It's a light-salmon-pink, and the flavors bring a touch of rosewater along with diluted cherry. The acids suggest lemon and lime, flesh and rind, with a finishing lick of grapefruit.

title: Avignonesi 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: This opens with subtle aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean herb, dark culinary spice and a whiff of violet. On the sleek light-bodied palate, polished tannins and fresh acidity underscore Marasca cherry, raspberry and clove. Drink through 2021.

title: Bledsoe 2015 Flying B Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from a hot vintage, the aromas bring notes of blackberry jam, coffee, fruit rollup, flower and herb. The tannins are quite firm, showing a bit of astringency out of the gate but settling down with some time open. Despite the warmth of the vintage, it brings a pleasing sense of acidity.

title: Château Barde Haut 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Ripe, luscious fruit flavors make this wine surprisingly approachable now. The smoky tannins and structure will allow the wine to age, but it is the generous juicy character of the wine that is immediately appealing.

title: Château Couvent des Jacobins 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Loaded with spicy oak, this wine has tight tannins that are covering the fruit. It is likely to be a crisp wine, retaining its flavors of bitter coffee for several years. Drink from 2023.

title: Château La Renaissance 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This is a concentrated wine. Full and rich, it has generous black fruit notes as well as plenty of juicy acidity adding freshness. It will develop quickly, drink from 2021.

title: Château de Cérons 2017 Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. A ripe wine, this is full of yellow fruits that are happily cut by citrusy acidity. The balance is just right, the acidity giving lift to the palate's richness and promising some more aging. Drink from 2021.
designation: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons Barrel Sample

title: Château Chemin-Royal 2017 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. There is already a serious amount of wood influence on this wine. It is going to take time for the fruit to come through the dense, dry texture. Certainly don't drink before 2023.

title: 51 Weeks 2016 Lonesome Springs Cuvée White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 60% Marsanne and 40% Viognier. Aromas are light, with notes of lime leaf, marzipan and white flower. It drinks dry, with stone fruit flavors throughout, and finishes a bit short.

title: Altos de Torona 2016 Sobre Lías Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Banana and pear aromas are lightly briny. A minerally mouthfeel is driven by citric acidity, while tangerine flavors are backed by sea-based briny notes. This offers real value; drink immediately.

title: Anam Cara 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Wädenswil Clone Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: A young vineyard has been planted with this old-school clone, which has a broad open mouthfeel, though it's not as concentrated as the Dijon clones. Strawberry and cherry fruit dominates, touched with orange peel and finishing with a lick of almond paste.

title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Just a touch of Conference pear hits the nose which appears in the same, subtle way on the dry palate. The body is slender and fresh while the finish is clean and moreish.

title: Early Mountain 2015 Quaker Run Vineyard Chardonnay (Virginia)
description: Tones of cereal and brioche ride over layers of lemon curd, overripe yellow apples and nuts. Mouthwatering acidity offers a lift to the weight, while the finish is long and racy.

title: Fonseca NV Bin 27 Finest Reserve  (Port)
description: This familiar brand exhibits the lush Fonseca style. Tannins are encased in generous red fruits, giving a wine that is smooth with just a touch of structure. This perfumed wine is ready to drink.

title: Foris 2014 Maple Ranch Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
description: Tart and racy, this brings juicy lip-licking berry flavors front and center. The high acidity may be over the top for some tasters, but set it up with a buttery poultry dish or a creamy sauce over pork or lamb and you're in the comfort zone.

title: Franciscan 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-made approachable wine, aromatic in black cherry, cola and plum. Thick ripe flavors are highlighted in brick, black pepper and toasted oak.

title: Izadi 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A ripe, fully oaked nose includes charred aromas along with herbal plum and currant scents. This wine has so much pep on the palate that it feels a touch raw, with a resiny oak offset. Woody plum and raspberry flavors finish with a final blast of oak.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Vieilles Vignes Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: The nose wants to give little away apart from a lemony hint of freshness. The palate is slender and dry, displaying a touch of apple and pear notes. This is easy, friendly and light. Drink soon.

title: Laurentia 2015 Stoltz Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Grand River Valley)
description: Spicy aromas of anise seed, licorice and black pepper are set against a blackberry backdrop. The mellow palate offers vanilla, blackberry and pepper, with crushed velvet tannins balanced by a fresh vein of acidity. Notes of white pepper and berries mark the finish.

title: Louis Guntrum 2015 Nierstein Rehbach Spätlese Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Broad apple, lemon and tangerine flavors meld on the palate of this rounded, richly textured spätlese. It's juicy and honeyed but briskly balanced by a delicate fringe of astringency on the finish. Drink now through 2021.

title: Masseria Altemura 2014 Altemura  (Primitivo di Manduria)
description: Savory herb and game aromas ride over a core of spiced cranberry and cherry in this wine. There's nice weight and tension, offering a balance of juicy red fruit flavors, earthy tones and lively acidity. Medium-grained tannins lend plenty of support.

title: Maysara 2016 Autees Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)
description: There is a distinctly sweet edge to this wine, suggesting that some residual sugar remains. Flavors and scents show honey and peach, with a hint of apple tart as well. Though made entirely in stainless steel, there's a light streak of caramel in the finish.

title: Melrose 2016 Riesling (Umpqua Valley)
description: Here is a well-balanced, lightly off dry style, with an emphasis on lemon-drop flavors. The residual sugar, listed at 20 g/l, shows as a bit of cotton-candy character. The wine is nicely concentrated and finishes with a streak of breakfast tea.

title: Mount Aukum 2015 Viognier (Fair Play)
description: This wine oozes fresh fruity, floral aromas and has light bright flavors to match. Touches of honey and orange come out on the palate, where the texture feels just right between a touch of richness and liveliness.

title: Nino Negri 2014 Quadrio  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Dark baking spice, wild berry and a whiff of pressed rose form a delicate bouquet. The light-bodied easygoing palate offers strawberry, pomegranate and a hint of tobacco alongside vibrant acidity and lithe tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Orma 2015 Passi di Orma  (Bolgheri)
description: A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and a hint of green olive. The straightforward palate offers vanilla, black-currant jam and a touch of caramel alongside smooth tannins.

title: Paniole 2015 Emineo  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Subtle aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and a whiff of underbrush lift out of the glass. The palate is easygoing, offering red currant jam, cinnamon and clove alongside velvety tannins.

title: Parras Wines 2016 Quinta do Gradil Red (Lisboa)
description: his crisp wine is full of red fruits and attractive acidity. It has some spice as well as a core of tannins that support the fruitiness. It is ready to drink.
